meanings.definition: To release or relax a clenched grip or hold.
meanings.sent1: She had to unclinch her fists after the tense meeting.
meanings.sent2: He slowly unclinched his jaw as he calmed down.
meanings.sent3: Trying to unclinch a jar lid can be quite a challenge sometimes.
meanings.sent4: As the tension eased, she felt her heart unclinch like a flower blooming.
meanings.sent5: The image of the peaceful beach helped her unclinch her worries.

meanings.definition: To loosen or open something that was tightly closed or held shut.
meanings.sent1: He carefully unclinched the knot in the rope.
meanings.sent2: The locksmith had to unclinch the stubborn lock to open the door.
meanings.sent3: She tried to unclinch the stuck zipper on her jacket.
meanings.sent4: The sun slowly unclinched the tight buds on the flowers, revealing their beauty.
meanings.sent5: With a gentle touch, he unclinched the old book, revealing its hidden contents.
